parameters: \pop[2]Eventually, we make it to the airfield, and I start to look around.
\pop[2]It was probably best to keep our plans quiet, so we chose to be cautious.
\pop[2]The airfield is huge, and Klace starts leading us to whatever plane he prefers.
\pop[2]We ended up choosing a plane that was at the far back of the field.
\pop[2]One that didn't look like it'd been used in a while, or would be used anytime soon.
\pop[2]The moment we enter, Klace closes the door behind us, leaving us in complete darkness.
\pop[2]I've never been in a private jet before, so I don't know what to expect.
\pop[2]Since Klace is hyping it up, though, my expectations are shooting sky-high.
\pop[2]A moment later, when he turns on the lights, those expectations are exceeded.
A real home away from home!
\pop[2]I quickly scan the room, taking in the beautiful sight before me.
\pop[2]There's no windows. Just one big screen, set to a scene of the sky.
\pop[2]Without even lifting off, it already feels like we're soaring the heavens.
\pop[2]We look over in Taylor's direction, and he's covering his face with his hands.
\pop[2]Upon hearing us call his name, he spreads his fingers, and looks out at us.
\pop[2]As he realizes the lights are on, he uncovers his face, and remains silent.
\pop[3]Heh. So much for thriving in the dark.
\pop[3]Oh. I didn't realize you were afraid of-
\pop[2]Before this can go any further, the \c[10]zero\c[0] steps forward.
\pop[2]Though I have to say, it's a bit peculiar that Taylor is afraid of the dark.
\pop[4]Damn. You weren't lying when you said this guy is famous.
And rich enough to call a jet his "home away from home", too?
Maybe you can just pay off \c[23]Argus\c[0] if we ever get in trouble.
Yeah, that would go over \c[14]so\c[0] well.
And that's not why I call this place a home away from home, either.
The real reason is - well - I guess it's kind of complicated.
\pop[3]Or we could be \c[14]real\c[0] friends, and let him explain.
This place clearly means a lot to him, right?
\pop[2]Klace looks both excited and happy as Taylor defends him.
\pop[2]Without wasting another moment, he jumps right into his explanation.
\pop[4]Well, you know how your home makes you feel, right?
Safe, secure, and happy. It's familiar, so it has a lot of meaning.
Coming home after a long day at work?
Couldn't think of a better feeling if I tried.
\pop[4]Well, I'm always traveling, so I don't really have a place like that.
These jets all share the same internal design, so it's the closest thing I had.
No matter where I was in the world, I could always come to place like this.
\pop[4]And for some reason, that gave me comfort.
\pop[2]We all look at one another, before Dante jumps in with some trademark snark.
\pop[4]Yeah, that basically sums up the life of an idol.
But during my visit, I hope Isaac's home can feel special, too.
Never really had the chance to live in a normal house.
\pop[3]And \c[10]Zero\c[0], \c[14]that\c[0] is why we let our friends speak.
Look at all that info you were about to shut down.
\pop[3]Sorry. The cold shoulder kind of became my go-to.
In the city, it's best not to risk exposing my identity.
Though I guess now, that won't be an issue.
\pop[3]You wanna get this show on the road?
\pop[2]Upon seeing the jet, and hearing Klace's story, I guess we got a bit derailed.
\pop[2]But the \c[10]zero\c[0] was right. We had some important business to take care of.
\pop[3]I heard something about the \c[23]PUPIL System\c[0] and \c[23]VP\c[0].
No clue what they are, but apparently they helped you cheat \c[23]Argus\c[0].
I think it's time we all take a seat.
\pop[2]As we all sit down, Isaac looks lots in thought.
\pop[2]I guess it wouldn't be easy to explain how he "cheated" \c[23]Argus\c[0].
\pop[2]It was a world first, after all. If it was easy to do, it would've been done by now.
I can't take the suspense anymore.
\pop[4]Oh? You want us to beat \c[23]Argus\c[0] to it?
\pop[2]The \c[10]zero\c[0] smirks, as Isaac finally breaks free from his train of thought.
\pop[4]Right. So the \c[23]PUPIL System\c[0] is basically a database of \c[14]everybody\c[0].
It's probably where the eyes of \c[23]Argus\c[0] find themselves the most.
When we signed up, that's actually where we put all our info in.
\pop[4]I have write-access, which means I can create identities.
When someone needs to sign up at my store, I can help them do it.
\c[23]Argus\c[0] just trusts me not to do anything more than that, I guess.
\pop[4]I've worked for them ever since I was old enough to work.
If there's anybody they trust with this clearance, it's me.
There \c[14]is\c[0] a bit more to it, however.
\pop[4]Like Klace said, he has a second acount.
A fake name, and a fake identity, in the name of his security.
There's already a precedent for this sort of thing. I just had to look into it.
\pop[4]Fake accounts and identities are mostly made for \c[14]two\c[0] groups of people.
Celebrities, like our popstar friend; and those who make use of the \c[23]VP Program\c[0].
Believe it or not, "fake" identities are created almost every day for it.
\pop[3]Oh, it is. People don't always have the best visions.
In situations like that, \c[23]Argus\c[0] can give them a new lease on life.
If you're a victim, or even commit a crime in your vision, they can relocate you.
\pop[3]It's mostly a precautionary measure, to stop crimes from occurring.
At least, in theory, they want to stop bad visions from coming to pass.
If you wanted to create an identity without suspicion, that'd be how.
Now that you explained it, I think I believe you.
\pop[4]Yeah, it was pretty simple at the end of the day.
At least for somebody in my position.
\pop[4]Yeah, I only beat \c[23]The System\c[0] that governs our lives.
Totally not a big deal, all things considered.
\pop[3]You need to work on your sarcasm, Isaac.
\pop[2]We laugh, and the tension in the room seems to disappear.
\pop[2]I can understand Isaac's explanation, at least a little bit.
\pop[2]That's a lot of pieces falling into place all at once.
\pop[2]Klace's second account, the \c[23]VP Program\c[0], the \c[23]PUPIL System\c[0], and Isaac's rank...
\pop[2]Even those sales he lost at work. They all combined to let him pull this off.
\pop[2]It really feels like a culmination of everything I've experienced thus far.
\pop[3]So basically, you walked a digital tightrope.
And now, it's up to me to follow your footsteps.
\pop[4]A bit of a bad metaphor, if you ask me.
I walked that rope, but turned it into a \c[14]road\c[0] for you.
All the risky business is already taken care of, I promise.
\c[10]Cipher\c[0] taught you how to put fake identities on phones.
And your position at \c[23]Argus\c[0] lets you "verify" those fake identities.
\pop[3]And you set it up like he were in the \c[23]VP Program\c[0].
So it's technically the same as Klace's burner account?
\pop[4]Well, I didn't want to snoop on him in the \c[23]PUPIL System\c[0].
But from what I gathered while studying, they're essentially the same.
And how many times has Klace gotten in trouble for using that account?
As far as \c[23]Argus\c[0] is concerned, all of us are the same now.
So what do you say - ready for your new life, \c[10]Zero\c[0]?
\pop[2]Isaac smiles, and takes out that phone once again.
\pop[2]He places it down in front of the \c[10]zero\c[0], who quickly picks it up.
\pop[2]I can tell he's confused, but he also looks incredibly happy.
\pop[3]So I can use this just like anybody else?
\pop[4]You sure can. And don't forget about the tavern this weekend!
From now on, you'll never drink booze off the streets again.
I don't know how to repay you, Isaac.
\pop[2]He smiles. Probably the first genuine one I've seen from him.
\pop[2]I take the city life for granted, and this made me realize it.
\pop[2]What was normal for me, was life-changing for Kyron.
\pop[3]Wait, he's gonna come to the tavern with us?
Is that really a good idea?
\pop[4]I'll go scope it out, but I don't see why not.
Wanna meet back here in a few days and talk it through?
\pop[3]Oh? Is this gonna be our new HQ?
But that's just because I have nowhere else to go.
\pop[4]Make yourself at home. The couches probably beat the street.
And yeah, we can meet again here when we need to talk.
Like I said, these things are really safe and secure.
\pop[4]So, like Taylor said then - new HQ?
\pop[2]He smiles, and for some reason, everything feels weird.
\pop[2]It's like we were at a turning point in our own history, and the history of society.
\pop[2]Kyron would always, and forever, be the first \c[10]zero\c[0] to integrate into \c[23]The System\c[0].
\pop[2]Maybe there was hope for everyone else after all...
